exhibition_description: Michael Kareken latest body of work tackles the urban landscape, specifically the industrial recycling plants outside his studio window. His paintings are inspired by the never ending piles and constant movement of Rock-Tenn paper recycling plant and the American Iron metal scrap yard he finds metaphoric associations with life and death, growth and decay, order and entropy, structure and chaos. For the MAEP show, Kareken is creating these paintings on a grandiose scale, creating wall size vistas of these plants.
